title: Modernizing Medicine Showcases Latest Advancements to EMA Otolaryngology® at the American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery Meeting and OTO Expo 2015
text:
Modernizing Medicine, Inc. 
BOCA RATON, Fla. -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- Modernizing Medicine, Inc. , the creator of the Electronic Medical Assistant ® (EMA™), a cloud-based, iPad native, specialty-specific electronic medical record (EMR) system, will unveil the latest enhancements to EMA Otolaryngology at this year’s American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery (AAO-HNSF) Annual Meeting and OTO Expo. 
Built by practicing ENTs, EMA Otolaryngology is pre-coded with otolaryngology-specific medical knowledge and knows the workflow of physicians specializing in ear, nose and throat conditions. This intuitive solution is available as a native iPad application and can be accessed via the Internet virtually anywhere and anytime. 
Through the convenience of a smartphone or tablet, doctors can capture images associated with patient symptoms and automatically upload the photos to the medical record. Plus, it’s an effective educational tool as physicians can show the photos to their patients. 
“EMA Otolaryngology was created using the same groundbreaking technology that has been so successful for our other specialties,” said Daniel Cane, CEO and co-founder of Modernizing Medicine. “In addition, with the new Protocols, physicians can develop their own master visits and customize their workflow. This will only further enhance EMA’s intuitive adaptive learning, since with only two clicks a physician can pull the master visit into the current visit to quickly document while seeing a patient. We look forward to showcasing EMA’s latest enhancements at this year’s conference.” 
“As a practicing head and neck surgeon, I had a difficult time finding an EMR system that knew my workflow and actually helped make me a more effective doctor,” said David Lehman, MD, Senior Medical Director of EMA Otolaryngology and EMA Ophthalmology®. “The development team and I built EMA with the level of detail to make it easy for me to generate an operative note, detailing every step I’ve done, in approximately 10 seconds. Plus, the automated coding can make the transition to ICD-10 easy as the EMA 3D Anatomic Atlas™ automatically captures information such as diagnostic details and laterality.” 
Members of the EMA Otolaryngology team will provide demonstrations at Modernizing Medicine booth #733 during the Annual AAO-HNSF OTO Expo in Dallas taking place from Sunday, September 27 – Tuesday, September 29. For more information about EMA Otolaryngology, please visit the Modernizing Medicine website . 
About Modernizing Medicine 
Modernizing Medicine ® is transforming how healthcare information is created, consumed and utilized in order to increase efficiency and improve outcomes. Our flagship product, Electronic Medical Assistant® (EMA™), is a cloud-based, specialty-specific electronic medical records (EMR) system built by practicing physicians. Available as a native iPad application and from almost any web-enabled Mac or PC, EMA adapts to each provider’s unique style of practice. This ICD-10 ready EMR system is available for the dermatology, ophthalmology, orthopedics, otolaryngology, gastroenterology, urology and plastic surgery markets and used by over 9,000 providers in the United States and its territories. The Modernizing Medicine family of companies also provides specialty-specific billing and inventory management, plus a gastroenterology platform consisting of an EMR system, Endoscopy Report Writer, practice management solution, patient portal, data analytics and revenue cycle management.
